meanings.definition: People who have left their own country to settle in another.
meanings.sent1: The emigres in our neighborhood come from different parts of the world.
meanings.sent2: The emigres at the community center shared stories of their homeland.
meanings.sent3: The emigres at the potluck brought dishes from their native countries.
meanings.sent4: The emigres' diverse backgrounds enriched the cultural fabric of the city.
meanings.sent5: The emigres' experiences of starting anew were both challenging and rewarding.

meanings.sent1: My great-grandfather was an emigres who came to this country for a better life.
meanings.sent2: The emigres spoke fondly of the traditions they left behind.
meanings.sent3: The emigres' accents added a unique charm to their speech.
meanings.sent4: The emigres' determination to succeed was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The emigres' journey to a new land was filled with hope and uncertainty.
